revised_title: Anatomical Study of the Organs of Vision in the Common Mole
tldr: The author examines the eye and optic nerve structures in both adult and foetal moles to understand the cause of the anomalous condition of the organ of vision in adult moles. The study reveals that the optic nerve and other structures related to sight undergo significant changes during the growth of the mole, and the eye of the adult mole lacks a cornea, sclerotic, iris, and pupillary aperture.
